Sampling.SampleDistributions: Sample distributions describe the distribution of a statistic within a single sample from a population.

SamplingDistributions.SamplingDistributionOfTheSampleMean: Description or details about the sampling distribution of the sample mean go here.
SamplingDistributions.SamplingDistributionOfTheSampleProportio: Description or details about the sampling distribution of the sample proportion go here.

Central Tendency.Mean: The average of all data points.
Central Tendency.Median: The middle value when data is ordered.

Measures of Dispersion.Range: The difference between the maximum and minimum values.
Measures of Dispersion.Variance: The average of the squared differences from the mean.
Measures of Dispersion.Standard Deviation: The square root of the variance.
Measures of Dispersion.Interquartile Range (IQR): The range between the first and third quartiles.
Measures of Dispersion.Mean Absolute Deviation (MAD): The average of the absolute deviations from the mean. MAD = (Σ|xi - μ|) / n
Measures of Dispersion.Coefficient of Variation (CV): A normalized measure of dispersion of a probability distribution or frequency distribution.

Measures of Position.Quartiles (Q1, Q2, Q3): Values that divide the data into 4 equal parts.
Measures of Position.Percentiles: Values that divide the data into 100 equal parts.
Measures of Position.Deciles: Values that divide the data into 10 equal parts.

Measures of Shape.Skewness: A measure of the asymmetry of the data distribution.
Measures of Shape.Kurtosis: A measure of the 'tailedness' of the data distribution.

Frequency Distributions.Frequency Tables: A table that displays the frequency of various outcomes in a sample.
Frequency Distributions.Histograms: A graphical representation of the distribution of numerical data.
Frequency Distributions.Bar Charts: A chart that presents categorical data with rectangular bars.
Frequency Distributions.Pie Charts: A circular statistical graphic divided into slices to illustrate numerical proportions.

Cross-Tabulations.Contingency Tables: A type of table in a matrix format that displays the frequency distribution of the variables.

Summary Statistics.Five-Number Summary: Includes the minimum, first quartile (Q1), median, third quartile (Q3), and maximum.
Summary Statistics.Box Plots: A visual representation of the five-number summary.

Correlation Measures.Pearson Correlation Coefficient: Measures the linear relationship between two variables.
Correlation Measures.Spearman Rank Correlation: Measures the monotonic relationship between two variables.
Correlation Measures.Kendall Tau Correlation: Measures the ordinal association between two variables.

Descriptive Statistics for Categorical D.Frequency Counts: The number of occurrences of each category.
Descriptive Statistics for Categorical D.Proportions and Percentages: Proportion and percentage of each category.

Descriptive Statistics for Time Series D.Trend Analysis: Examining data to identify consistent upward or downward movement.
Descriptive Statistics for Time Series D.Seasonality Analysis: Looking for repeating patterns or cycles in the data at regular intervals.
Descriptive Statistics for Time Series D.Autocorrelation: The correlation of a signal with a delayed copy of itself.

Inferential Statistics.Population Distribution: The population distribution refers to the distribution of a variable across all members of a population.

EDA.description: Exploratory Data Analysis involves summarizing the main characteristics of a dataset, often with visual methods, to uncover patterns, spot anomalies, test hypotheses, and check assumptions.

Data Visualization.Scatter Plots: Examine relationships between two continuous variables.

Descriptive Statistics.Summary Statistics: Basic measures such as mean, median, and standard deviation.
Descriptive Statistics.Frequency Distributions: Understand the distribution of categorical variables.

Data Cleaning.Identifying Outliers: Methods to detect and manage outliers.
